title.rendered: How NOT to Approach a Cop!

content.rendered:
The cop seen here is responding to a call about a guy who’s car is sitting in the median as the driver is apparently running around trying to stop other vehicles and yell at people.

As soon as the officer pulls up the guy gets out of his car (first mistake), starts yelling at the officer (second mistake) then aggressively approaches him (third and most idiotic mistake) then gets immediately tased and sent to the ground.

We realize a lot of police are under the microscope for being overly aggressive or brutish because some bad apples out there are making good cops look bad but there’s no excuse for this guy to be so woefully unaware that you can’t just approach a cop like that and not expect to get hit with a taser!

title.rendered: Brutal Motorbike Accident for Guy Martin

content.rendered: Guy Martin is an 11-times Ulster GP winner who suffered a horrible accident after losing control of his Tyco BMW at Ireland’s corner during the Co Antrim circuit. While he suffered breaks to his ribs and even a few vertebrae but he’s already recovering very well and has his family by his side!

title.rendered: Using a Bugatti Veyron to Weed Out Gold Diggers

content.rendered:
Ever wonder how easy it must be to pick up women with a super car at your side? Owning one lets everyone around you know you’ve obviously got some money and lets face it: a lot of women tend to go for money.

These guys decided to borrow a friend’s Bugatti Veyron and film one of them trying to ask some women to get a bite to eat. All the women appear interested but only as long as the car actually belongs to the guy asking them out. After they agree to go out to eat with him he shows them his real ride (a typical white sedan) and they suddenly all come up with some sort of excuse – proving that many of these women are only interested in someone with swole pockets. Except for the honest woman at the end!

title.rendered: This Crane Tragedy is One of the Scariest Things You’ll See All Day

content.rendered: Over in the Netherlands, a crew was working on constructing a bridge when this horrible accident occurred. The crew was using a barge and two enormous cranes to help lift and place a large section of bridge when the weight to counter weight ratio must have been mistaken. The cranes wind up collapsing after listing the barge entirely too heavily. Early reports don’t indicate any deaths as a result but there are at least 20 injured.

_yoast_wpseo_opengraph-description: Over in the Netherlands, in the Alphen aan den Rijn specifically, a crew was working on constructing a bridge when this horrible accident occurred. The crew was using a barge and two enormous cranes to help lift and place a large section of bridge when the weight to counter weight ratio must have been mistaken. The cranes wind up collapsing after listing the barge entirely too heavily. Early reports don't indicate any deaths as a result but there are at least 20 injured.

title.rendered: The Weirdest Bridge in the World is Over 100 Years Old

content.rendered: This is the Newport Transporter Bridge. It’s a local attraction in Wales where it was built over 100 years ago. It’s a unique and strange type of bridge that’s no longer constructed these days. However, 100 years ago when Wales needed a bridge over this river they couldn’t construct a typical bridge of the time because of the space required to make something big enough for large ships to pass under. They also couldn’t create a typical ferry since the water depth changes so dramatically up and down all day long!

title.rendered: The Best Rage Fail You’ll See All Day!

content.rendered:
A cyclist over in England was wearing a few cameras when a car passed him too closely. He proceeded to chase down the driver to tell him (rather politely at first) that he should be more careful. The driver of the vehicle wasn’t having any of it. He starts cursing and screaming at the cyclist. The guy in the car gets to into his road rage that he loses his ability to speak actual insults and curses!

When the cyclist starts the leave the man gets out to chase him down. He tries to kick the cyclist but winds up tripping and falling end over end! We could watch this guy lose his cool and take a tumble all day long!

title.rendered: The Scariest Bridge in the United States

content.rendered:
The Chesapeake Bay bridge is considered the scariest bridge in America. It’s not necessarily the most dangerous but it terrifies most motorists.

The bridge is 200 feet high in certain parts and is roughly 4 miles long. The drive is so daunting that one man has started a booming business that drives people, in their cars, over the bridge. He keeps the conversation casual and light and acts almost like a therapist of sorts for people who begin to feel panic attacks mid trip!

title.rendered: When This Guy in the Ferrari Starts Getting a Ticket You Won’t Believe What He Tries to Do!

content.rendered:
Someone captured this footage while walking around New York and stumbling upon a cop writing a parking ticket for a Ferrari 458 Spider. Thinking it might make for a decent video he starts filming. It turns out the car was parked inside the designated valet area for a hotel and while it’s unclear as to why the ticket was being issued in the first place the owner of the Ferrari approached as the cop was writing the ticket. The owner complains briefly and tries to refuse the ticket (Mistake #1) while getting in his car and starting it up.

Then, as you can make out in the video, as the guy tries to drive away he actually runs over the cop’s foot (Incredibly Huge Mistake #2)! That’s technically assault right there so the cop drags his spoiled ass out the window and gets set to arrest him. Then his girlfriend, Stephanie Pratt from the MTV show The Hills is left to drive him while he gets arrested.

title.rendered: You Won’t Believe What Happens to a Parked Ferrari

content.rendered:
Super car owners, like the owner of this Ferrari have all the reason in the world to be concerned about where they leave their car unattended. Strangers and pedestrians tend to notice things like a Ferrari and can’t help but stop to admire. However this owner decided to keep some cameras rolling to catch those passing by in action.

Many people wind up stopping to take selfies and that’s all well and good (especially if most look like the cute girl who stops her jog the second the car catches her attention) but those kids need to learn to not touch things that aren’t their’s! Don’t even get us started on what we’d do to that guy who spits no the windshield!

title.rendered: Biker Asks a Bike Cop to Race and He Agrees!

content.rendered:
This guy pulled up to a stop light and started chatting with the bike officer next to him. They compare bikes and talk about the weather when the biker asks the cop if he wants to race. The cop warns the biker that he’s got a turbo but that’s not scaring him. They take off and we won’t spoil the results but then the cop winds up getting fired for the stunt!

He’s since been reinstated but that’s one damn cool cop if you ask us!

content.rendered: This police officer seems to be responding to a call along side many other cops when his bike is the first to hit a hard to see speed bump. Because it comes up so unexpectedly his back end gets launched and he has a hard time controlling the bike. It flips over and sends him face first into the pavement (lets hear it for helmets!) before almost bringing the entire bike down on top of him!

title.rendered: Helicopter Landing Ends in Disaster When the Rotor Clips a Low Wire

content.rendered:
Disaster struck when a the back rotor of this helicopter clipped a low hanging wire.

Miraculously, the pilot was rescued from the wreckage with only minor injuries.

He even managed to walk away from the wreck with some assistance from two first res ponders.

title.rendered: Lamborghini’s Paint Job Transforms Into Captain America

content.rendered:
There’s no better a canvas for an artist than a Lamborghini Gallardo. The cars themselves already look pristine and amazing but when you see what this Lambo’s paint job can turn into with a just some water you’ll be blown away!

A graffiti artist from German named Rene Turrek used temperature sensitive color changing paint to make this Italian bull look like the most American car that’s ever existed! Water hitting the back end reveals the stars and stripes while the hood gives way to the image of the first Avenger, Captain America himself!

title.rendered: Guy Gets Tasered Trying to Put Fake Poop on a Lamborghini

content.rendered: These two guys were driving along when they claim some guy in a Lamborghini cut them off, shot them the bird and was generally a huge jerk. So they followed him to where he was shopping and decided to prank him in retaliation by placing fake poop on the windshield. When the guy came out one man filmed from the safety of their car while the other pretended to be putting his shorts back on as if he had just finished the act. title.rendered: Fox and Friends Fail Manhood Test of Changing a Tire

content.rendered:
A retired Navy SEAL wrote a book that describes a slow death of manhood that’s taking over the country as people are raised up and obsessed with their phones, tables and computers. He came on Fox and Friends to promote his book as demonstrate some of the more “manly” things that people should know how to do. Everything with the segment was going along well until the hosts demonstrated how to change a tire….

The two guys trying to change the tire pretty much stumble upon every mistake you can possibly make when changing a tire: they remove the lug nuts entirely before lifting car, they push on the car while it’s on the jack and they even try to remove the tire before all the nuts have been removed!

title.rendered: Road Rage Against Bikers Turn Violent

content.rendered:
This footage came from a couple on their bike after they stopped at a light when they were approached by a man who was yelling at them. When the guy walks up on them the driver asks if something’s wrong when the man just starts swinging! The motorcyclists absolutely know how to handle themselves in the face of an assailant! They subdue the man and keep him pinned to the ground while others rush in to help call the police.

It’s later determined that the man was clearly under the influence of some drug or alcohol and the legal process against him continues but lets definitely give a hand to the guy who made certain that he subdued his attacker and waited for the proper authorities to arrive!

title.rendered: Is a Gold Chromed Camaro A Good Thing or a Bad Thing?

content.rendered:
We’ve all seen plenty of custom body kits, light kits, and engine mods. We’ve seen Ferraris wrapped in velvet and super cars littered with so many trinkets that you wouldn’t be able to recognize the Bugatti underneath it all. In Japan there’s an entire culture of teens who sport super cars and luxury vehicles with all kinds of different body wraps and lights mods just for show.

However, this gold chromed Camaro stands above the rest. Whoever put this together is really trying to make one hell of a statement. We’re not entirely certain how good a statement that might be. What do you think? Is a gold chromed Camaro a good look or a bad one?

title.rendered: Road Raging Biker Uploads His Temper Tantrum for All to See

content.rendered:
Now, no one likes it when people cut them off…especially bikes and for good reason! They’re definitely more susceptible to accidents and bodily harm than people in cars. However, this biker goes of the deep end and cries all the way home like a little piggy!

He starts the video claiming this guy cut him off repeatedly but we only really see it happen the one time and it’s not even that bad, the guy just simply didn’t use a signal (which is a big no no in our book but it wasn’t like it was insanely close or anything). Then the biker goes off on a cursing tirade all the while bitching and moaning about the convertible. He gets in driver’s face, leaving his back in a turning lane and holding up traffic himself! Personally, we feel like this guy is just adding to the scores of bad drivers and road raging buffoons who already litter the streets with their poor habits. What do you think?

title.rendered: Traffic Stops Dead for a Showdown Between a Mongoose and a Cobra

content.rendered: Meet Honey Badger’s cousin, the Mongoose…he don’t give a damn!  Traffic came to a dead stop as people crowded around to watch one of the best “street fights” to ever take place! title.rendered: See-Through Semi Trucks Are Coming

content.rendered:
Giant semis are all over our highways and it’s hard to see around them when attempting to pass. There is some new technology coming to help with that!

Now Samsung is beginning to produce a brand new safety feature for all trucks. It’s a camera system that sends a feed of what the front of the truck see to 4 massive screens located on the trucks back. This way people know exactly what they can’t see due to the truck!

title.rendered: Motorcycle Chases Down Hit and Run Driver

content.rendered: While on a motorcycle tour of Germany this guy caught a driver who very deliberately ran into the side of a scooter and took down its driver. While dash cams are illegal in Germany this guy technically had one on his helmet and was using it for tourism purposes. He dropped off his passenger to help the victim then he took off in pursuit! He caught the driver and after the police arrived the driver lost his license and the victim is alright!

title.rendered: The Strongest Jeep Grand Cherokee You’ll Ever See

content.rendered:
This insane Jeep Grand Cherokee SRT-8 sports 1,000 HP! It’s got a 7.0L (426 cubic inch) Stroker Engine and 3.6 Kenne Bell supercharger.

On the drag strip it covers the 1/8 mile 6.44 @ 107 MPH and the 1/4 mile in 10.09 @ 135 MPH!

title.rendered: Ford F-150 Runs Over Ferrari

content.rendered:
Lets say you have the means to order a new Ferrari 458 Italia. You wait the year to year and a half it takes for it to finally be built and arrive. You drive it around for a few days and immediately fall in love. You attempt to cross a few solid yellow lines to hurry up on day and then find the front end of your brand new Ferrari under the wheel of a Ford F-150.

Luckily for the owner of this nearly doomed Ferrari the front of the car is merely the trunk space so the damage done isn’t Ferrari-life threatening but this is certainly heartbreaking none the less!

title.rendered: Lawnmower Drag Racing is Real and Awesome

content.rendered: Most people are pretty proud of their riding lawnmowers. These guys take that pride to a whole new level. Typically these lawnmowers run around all of 20 HP but they’ve got super lightweight frames and construction. They’re actually able to move so fast that they need larger, extended wheels put on the back!

title.rendered: The Million Dollar Ford Excursion Monster

content.rendered: Meet the Sin City Hustler. It’s a massive 12 feet tall, 32 feet long, can seat 13 people and only costs $1 million dollars. Its power comes from a 8.5-liter, 700-HP V-8. Lets not also forget about the amenities like bucket seats and power windows – and for something this large: four wheel steering! This far from the most practical truck to drive around in but we can’t help to imagine what it’d be like to have a day out in the dunes with this boss!

title.rendered: Incredible Mud Truck Defeated by Pavement

content.rendered: Watch this poor guy do the loser limp off the strip.  This is the Sick 50. It has rightfully achieved boss status. It’s loaded with a blown alcohol injected 540 big block engine, a killer red and black color scheme, matte black spoke rims, a nice throwback of a grille, two and a half ton axles and a turbo 400 transmission. This beauty was made to carve up the mud! However, after just a few minutes of showing this beast off its wheels lock up and leave the owner with more than a bit of embarrassment.

title.rendered: Does the ATL have the best monthly car show in the USA?

content.rendered:
If this sweet clip doesn’t get you all tingly, we don’t know what will.

Caffeine & Octane has been an Atlanta tradition for almost 10 years. The first Sunday of each month over 650 classics, muscles and exotics gather to showcase their beauty for hundreds of drooling attendees. Best of all, it’s free.

Have you been? What are some other monthly car shows alt_driver should visit?

We’ll be out at Caffeine & Octane on June 7, 2015. Visit Caffeine & Octane for details.

title.rendered: Man Chases Down Hit and Run Driver

content.rendered: This dash cam footage came from a man who watched a car in front of him run a red light and hit a woman on a bike. While the woman appears mostly alright, with just her bike frame and tire slightly bent, she’s trying to speak with the driver and figure things out when he just takes off. The man in the car filming wasn’t about to have any of that. He chases the driver down a few streets to let him know he’s got the whole thing recorded so they had better return to the scene of the accident!

title.rendered: Self Parking Car Fail

content.rendered: Down in the Dominican Republic comes footage of this self parking car demonstration. Sadly, it doesn’t really go as planned. The car itself should be able to send objects immediately around it and brake when necessary. This particular demo looks as though it was they meant to show off the car’s ability to stop on a dime autonomously. At least that’s the only explanation as to why the man in the pink shirt didn’t bother moving as the car started speeding towards him.

title.rendered: Be Kind and Please Rewind for Some 90s Nostalgia

content.rendered:
If you were in a car in the 90s…

1. You sat in the “back, back”

Flickr / Travis Rigel Lukas Hornung

Or the Way, Way Back if your mom was dating Steve Carell

 

2. You were almost decapitated by the seat belt

colinc3 / YouTube

3. You used a road atlas…complete with trip notes


Flickr / Jimmy Thomas

4. You watched “Speed” on VHS in a conversion van


Flickr / Tracie Hall

5. You jammed out to a copy of your BFF’s mix tape


cheezburger.com

6. You rolled up your window and spilled your Surge

     

7. You used a car phone to page someone

    
Flickr / ShaneK & Flickr / Hades2k

And they called you back from a payphone

 

8. You did your part in the war on crime


piloteers.org

9. You had junk in the trunk

   
Flickr / Paul Altobelli
 
YouTube / Funny Fails

10. Your car had boobs

 
Wikipedia

title.rendered: The Ghost of The General Lee

Granted he’s not doing all the work himself, he even talks of some guys and a shop he’s been using a fair bit but it’s still really impressive that someone at that young an age can dedicate so much work towards a beautiful and classic car!

title.rendered: Jalopnik Test Drives New Camaro and Crashes, Then Gets Tossed From GM

content.rendered:
Patrick George is a writer for Jalopnik who recently had a pretty bad time in a Camaro. Not any Camaro, the brand new 2016 Camaro. GM invited him and other journalists out to the Belle Island track in Detroit to see their new Camaro and each got to drive a mule (a version of the car with a weird white and black camo paint cover) for a press event. While following one car behind the lead Patrick took the wrong line going into a turn and wound up hitting the wall. GM wasn’t all that fond of Jalopnik since they leaked their C7 Corvette in the first place so they didn’t take too kindly to Patrick for the wreck and they requested he leave the facility.

Sorry Patrick, that’s a legitimate bummer!

title.rendered: A Man Outbid the Son of a Fallen Sheriff Over His Old Police Car, Then Gifts Him the Car!

content.rendered: Here’s a heart warming story to brighten your day. Five years ago this guy’s father was a Sheriff who tragically died in the line of duty. The police department eventually put his old Charger up for auction. The Sheriff’s son had saved up money to try and purchase his late father’s car as a keepsake. However he was out bid at the last moment and couldn’t go any higher. It’s then that the man who outbid him decided to help the young man out and see his father’s car returned to family it belongs in!

title.rendered: Photographing NASCAR

content.rendered: For those that have never been to a live race, especially a NASCAR race, have no idea just how FAST drivers are racing around the track. You simply can’t conceptualize the sheer speed by watching it on television or online. You have to be right up next to the track to catch the blur speed past you and the wind nearly knock you down. Until you can see it for yourself watch this video of a photographer posted up just barely off the track to get a sense of just how quickly NASCAR races really run.

content.rendered: Just earlier this month during a Street Car Shootout event at the Cecil County Dragway, Dirk Miller had a rough crash where he struck the wall twice before coming to a stop. title.rendered: Incredible Wrecker Skills!

content.rendered:
This tow truck driver skillfully answered the scene of a pretty gnarly accident. The Charger driver suffered a seizure behind the wheel and wound up careening over the cub, crushing the front end of the Honda Accord and rolling the Civic on its side. No one was hurt but it all needed to be cleaned up.

The wrecker uses a healthy amount of physics prowess to wrestle the Charger free with as little additional damage to the other cars as possible.

title.rendered: Motorcyclist Tries to Cut Through Stalled Traffic, Gets Pissed When it Doesn’t Work Out

content.rendered:
In this video from JukinVideo, this motorcyclist is undeniably aggravated at other drivers who lack the foresight to not block intersections when traffic is heavy and lights change. He decides to cut through some cars blocking the way when one driver nudges forward at the perfectly wrong moment. He taps the rider and causes him to lay his bike down.

Now, the biker is understandably angry but should he have avoided trying that move in the first place?

title.rendered: Did the Police Pull Over the Wrong Challenger For Speeding?

content.rendered:
Dodge Challenger rockets past cop, but does the cop run down the right one? We then see the police in hot pursuit. Just a few moments down the road the camera picks up the police having pulled over a Challenger, presumably the same one the driver spotted earlier. However when the driver comes up upon the pulled over vehicle it appears to be an entirely different Challenger. It’s got an entirely different package with different stripes, chrome additions and wheels.

The story goes that the driver contacted the police who weren’t interested in the dash footage. However after posting the video to some Challenger forums the web has come through and the police are now suddenly interested in what the cam picked up.

Check out more on the story over at Japlonik.

title.rendered: Upside Down Truck Mod

content.rendered: Auto mechanic, Rick Sullivan, took six months, $6,000, and a boatload of spare parts to create this unique conversion. It’s a ’91 Ford Ranger with a ’95 F-150 body on top. The BMW driver then decides, like a genius, he’s going to get in front of said truck and teach him a lesson with a series of increasingly poor brake checks.
Learn from this man.
Do no repeat his mistakes.

title.rendered: Life Size Lego Car That’s Powered by Air!

content.rendered: Melbourne entrepreneur Steve Sammartino got together with a self taught tech guru of sorts named Raul Oaida and created what they’re calling the Super Awesome Micro Project. It’s a car made up of more than 500,000 Lego pieces that includes four orbital engines and 256 pistons that somehow runs on air!…Or so they claim. We think there’s a hidden tank somewhere but regardless, this is still an incredible feat!

title.rendered: Is Eleanor the Ultimate Muscle Car?

content.rendered: It’s the only Ford Mustang in history to receive star title credit in a movie. Eleanor was played by a 1971 Ford Mustang Sportsroof in the original Gone in 60 Seconds and a 1967 Shelby GT500 in the Cage version. She’s been recreated all over the world for over forty years. Check out this great tribute from the Netherlands.

title.rendered: Drunk Camaro Driver Causes Big Crash

content.rendered: This guy just so happened to install a dash cam days prior to witnessing this crash. You see the Camaro swerving and failing to maintain a lane behind the truck on the left for some time. He can’t pass on the right due to the semi. After making his poor driving ability and probably intoxication apparent to the whole road he tries to pass on the shoulder and causes some massive devastation. The driver was later arrested and charged with Aggravated Driving While Intoxicated and Aggravated Unlicensed Operation of a Motor Vehicle.

title.rendered: Supercars Abandoned Everywhere in Dubai

content.rendered:
Default on your car payments and go to jail, or ditch that Bugatti at the airport and run. What’s an oil magnate to do?

Dubai even faces one of the richest epidemics to ever strangle a city: abandoned supercars. There are laws about going to jail for holding too much debt. Some decide to flee and leave behind scores of abandoned supercars.

_yoast_wpseo_opengraph-title: Supercars Abandoned Everywhere in Dubai
_yoast_wpseo_opengraph-description: The United Arab Emirates is known around the world for the city of Dubai. It's an incredibly extravagant place where the super rich live lives like wealthy Bond villains. Dubai even faces one of the richest epidemics to ever strangle a city: abandoned supercars. Scores of Americans and Europeans made their way to Dubai during the boom years around a decade ago. They made money hand over fist and started living the life and buying up insane cars left and right. For many though, things came crashing down all too quickly. There are laws about going to jail for holding too much debt so many of these same westerners decided to flee and left behind scores of abandoned supercars.

title.rendered: Double Impact Wreck Caught on Dashcam

content.rendered:
This guy was involved in a serious front and rear impact accident. He was unharmed and captured it all on dashcam!

He’s stopped and prepared to take a left turn when a Silverado rear-ends him. As if that weren’t bad enough, he is pushed into oncoming traffic and gets slammed by an approaching delivery truck. Not only is it amazing that the driver escaped completely unharmed, but also that he had two cameras running to capture the whole thing!

title.rendered: Dashcam Shows Cop Ramming Crime Spree Suspect

content.rendered: In Tuscon, AZ a man allegedly stole a rifle from a Wal-Mart and began wandering the streets while pointing his gun at his head threatening suicide. The cops were already on him telling him to stop and calm down but he wouldn’t submit. He even fires a shot off getting past the trigger lock. As he’s about to begin walking towards several businesses, where officers were afraid he may try to take hostages, one officer decided to take action and mowed him down to stop him.

title.rendered: Hyundai Helps a Daughter Send a Message to Her Astronaut Father

content.rendered: Stephanie’s father is an astronaut aboard the International Space Station, so communicating with him isn’t exactly easy. Hyundai decided to help her out. They organized an event where 11 Genesis sedans took a dry lake bed and drove in perfect formation to spell out a message to her father. Along the way, they also netted the Guinness World Record for the largest tire track image that covered about 2.15 miles and could easily be seen from space!

title.rendered: Edmund Burgess Crashes a $400k 1924 Bugatti

content.rendered:
56-year-old Edmund Burgess from Lavenhan, Suffolk competed in the Prescott Speed Hill Climb in Winchcombe, Gloucestershire on Sunday, June 2, 2013.

During his run, the brakes on his 1924 classic Bugatti racing car failed. Even though the vehicle flipped right over, Burgess dusted himself off and after paramedics assessed him, he headed straight to the bar where he had a beer.

title.rendered: Speed Comparison Between F1 and GT Races

content.rendered: Everyone knows that F1 cars race a whole hell of a lot faster than your typical GT machines. However, it’s not until you see the same cars tackle the same track that you really begin to appreciate the immense differences between their relative speeds!

title.rendered: The Perfect Solution to a Small Garage

content.rendered: For some, garage space is an all too sought after thing. It’s rare enough to have a good amount of space for two cars but what if you only have the width for on vehicle? What if the doors to your garage cut off valuable parking space? UK based Total Lifting Solutions has come up with this simple device to help you get the most out of any space in your garage by allowing you to push your cars from side to side.

title.rendered: Leona Chin Pranks Driver’s Ed Instructors With Speed, Drifting and Sheer Terror!

content.rendered: Driver’s Education can be a pretty high pressure institution for both students and the instructors. One driving school in particular thought it would be fun to prank their newest teachers on their first day. This is where Leona Chin comes in. She’s a professional racer and drifter from Malaysia. Inspired by Jeff Gordon’s terrific prank last year, she got dressed up like a shy nerd who almost seems afraid of cars from the onset. Once she confirms the instructor’s snap judgments about her inept driving abilities she asks for one more try and then really drops the pedal!

title.rendered: Learn Fear as You See This 28.5L Fiat Drive For the First Time in a Century

content.rendered: Ever seen really old photos of people driving from 100 years ago and they’re all wearing ear muffs or hats of some kind? It’s basically because cars this old weren’t so great at hiding the noise and firepower of their primitive engines. Duncan Pittaway spent 10 years restoring this unique record holding car and now it’s not only been started against for the first time recently but here you can actually see it being driven!

title.rendered: Insane Drifter Putting Lives at Risk on Melbourne Roads

content.rendered: A truck driver got dash cam footage of a pair of cars terrorizing the Melbourne, Australia rush hour morning commute. The red car acts as a support to the black car that drifts back and forth all down a large bridge. With each maneuver he’s narrowly missing all nearby cars. If there were trying to impress people then they completely failed. Every driver that had footage and spoke to the police absolutely sought their arrest. Police are posting footage of their risky joyride all over television and social media in an attempt to bring these dangerous fools to justice.

Worse yet, have you ever reached the truck and driver just as they’re finished loading your car up and they won’t let it down for you because “it’s already up”?

Well enjoy this Jeep driver’s brazen disregard for tow truck drivers as he mounts a daring escape off the lift and out of sight!

title.rendered: L.A. High Speed Spring Break Chase

content.rendered: A vehicle with the phrase “We Support Our Local Police Dept” got that local police department’s attention when it was seen driving on the wrong side of the road. Police chased him around Anaheim and tried to pin him down in busy parking lots but failed. In his stolen car he repeatedly taunts the police, fake salutes out the window and drives in circles as the police keep trying to hit him. When finally cornered he gives up and throws his hands in the air and hits the pavement like he already knows the drill.

title.rendered: Father Stops Dangerous Police Chase Near Kids With His Truck

content.rendered:
In Syracuse, Utah comes this footage near what appears to be a school or playground in a suburban area. It begins with footage of children playing in a field as the woman filming them tells them to get out of the way as a suspect being chased by the police tears through the field. He must have decided to try going through the same area again however this time a local father decides to get in his truck and bring this dangerous suspect to his end!
He drives straight into the perpetrator and brings this dangerous chase to a close!

The person who filmed this video claims that this particular trooper has a history of violating FHP policies as he routinely chases down motorcycles and harasses the riders. In this video he’s chasing down another biker when this citizen starts recording him and then blares his horn right before the trooper nearly slams the biker into the wall! He even goes so far as to deliberately evade the car filming him!

title.rendered: A Flying Car on the Market by 2017?

content.rendered:
October 2014, a Slovakian company called AeroMobil showed off a prototype concept car that was capable of flying. The flying car has long been a fantasy of auto owners and generally regarded as the next logical step in future technology. The AeroMobil 3.0 is a carbon fiber clad two seater that drives around with its wings tucked in. Once you can get it to a field or runway, you can open her wings up and take to the sky. They claim the car only needs about 650 feet of runway or field space to take off and just 160 feet to land.

According to AeroMobil themselves, who declared this during this year’s SXSW event, you can expect these crazy hybrid vehicles to be available for purchase in just two year’s time!

title.rendered: Hitting a Wall at 100 MPH

content.rendered: This incredible interior cam footage is of Ryan Savage. He’s a 17 year old driver who took to Donington racetrak earlier this month. He was navigating the terrifying corners, the Craner Curves when his car suffered a rear suspension failure. He was already traveling at 110 MPH when he flew off the track and into the wall just 2 seconds later at the barely reduced speed of 100 MPH. Thankfully he only suffered a non-serious shoulder injury and a slight concussion as the bulk of the impact was taken in by the rear of the car.

title.rendered: Goodyear to Build Electricity Generating Tires!

content.rendered: Everyone knows that cars typically waste tons of energy while driving around. With so much energy expended as a car operates, there’s been advancements to help capture and use some of that lost power. Things like regenerative brakes in hybrid cars work to help make up some of the loss but hardly do the job well. However, Goodyear has a novel idea: They want to take the heat generated turning tires and transfer it into electricity. This is certainly a new idea that when effectively established may help extend the range of electric vehicles and beyond!

title.rendered: Insurance Scammer Gets Tossed

content.rendered: Russia is the capital of dash cams for a very good reason. People over there try to scam other drivers constantly. They typically run in front of cars and jump out at the last minute to then claim they were struck so they can get damages. In this particular instance, which took place just the other day, two scammers are trying to dart in front of traffic. The first car knows what they’re up to and won’t buy it. One of the idiots then decides the car coming up might not hurt too much and he throws himself into it, however it must have been moving must faster because it tossed him a good 15 feet!

title.rendered: No Denying the DeLorean is Still a Cool Car

content.rendered:
The DeLorean DMC-12 is a car with a crazy history. The car was poorly made right out of the gate and wasn’t terribly fast either. It didn’t take long for the company to go out of business (John DeLorean was getting arrested for drug trafficking). Of course, it made it’s place in pop culture history when Robert Zemeckis tapped it to serve as his famous time machine in the Back to the Future series.

Despite the car’s checkered past, there’s no denying that there is love for the DeLorean. In this video, Geoff Ombao discusses the DeLorean he purchased and what he loves about it.

title.rendered: Redneck Trucker Denies Driver’s Attempted Merging

content.rendered:
You’re hauling a rig through Alabama and trying to work in a phone call. All of a sudden, traffic starts darting in front of you to escape being held back by a semi. Sure, it’s annoying to see other drivers not care about how they’re impacting the road, but when that one car tries to pull something off, and it always does, you refuse to let it do so.

Such is the case with this trucker who claims to have not noticed the black Volkswagen trying to merge into the his lane. Sure, the car is technically ahead of the truck but there’s not enough room for any sane person to think they’ll fit safely. Maybe the VW assumed the truck would back off and give space? Maybe the truck thought the VW would realize they shouldn’t try to run a truck off the road? It appears to us the truck driver saw the encroaching VW and chose to take a stand.

title.rendered: Momkhana: Minivan Drifting

content.rendered: Famous Footwear put together an interesting advertisement. They took a “mother” and her “kids” and tossed them in a 550 HP engine minivan and set the driver loose on a closed course. If this was the typical drive home from school for children, I doubt anyone would care about having to ride in a minivan.

title.rendered: Porsche Cayenne Attempts to Cross a River

content.rendered: Here’s a brief video showing someone’s attempt to cross a river with their Porsche Cayenne. Now I don’t care what I’m driving, I’ve played enough Oregon Trail growing up to know the dangers of fording rivers. You can lose oxen, axles, someone in your group might get dysentery, the point is that there’s a lot that can go wrong trying to bring a vehicle across lots of flowing water. These people sacrificed something far more expensive than anything from Oregon Trail.

title.rendered: Driver Tries to Mow Down Biker After Kick

content.rendered: Here’s one for the road rager in all of us. In this video guy on a bike tries to squeeze between two parked cars. The driver of one must have said something to the biker because the biker then kicks the car. The driver then tries to drive into the biker. He lays his bike down and goes after the driver again only to get nearly run over a second time. I’m thinking both the driver and biker should be taken off the road.

title.rendered: “Stop a Douchebag” Movement Encounters The Hulk

content.rendered: The Russian youth organization called Stop a Douchebag is getting to be fairly well known. Now as the stop cars for driving on the sidewalk and various other offenses, those drives are calling them out and then acquiescing to the actual rules of the road. This episode is particularly funny as they encounter one, rather large fellow, who climbs out of his car calling himself the Hulk – which, given his size, you’d think he’d consider an insult. He relents but they also catch a service truck driving on the side walk following a street sweeper which refuses to stop for them, so naturally, it gets a sticker. What’s even funnier is the “Call Number to report unsafe driving” tag the truck has on the back.

title.rendered: Pre-War Ford 1942 “X-Ray” Chassis

content.rendered:
Ford was just ramping up production of their new 1942 models when World War II rerouted production for a greater cause.

The 1942 Fords were introduced on September 12, 1941. Only 160,211 were built before World War II erupted and brought the production of civilian automobiles to a halt. One of the rarest 1942 Fords made wasn’t a complete car at all, but a body-less chassis with running gear that Ford intended to use as a prop at auto shows to illustrate the features of 1942 Fords.

This “X-ray” Ford was specially painted to look attractive at auto shows that probably never took place. It has survived through the years and is now a part of the Lensing Auto Museum in Roscoe, Illinois. Wayne Lensing, the owner of Lefthander Chassis, a company that sells racing car parts and supplies, established this museum. It features racing cars, personality cars, presidential cars and unusual attractions like the working Ford chassis.

Since the early Ford V-8 chassis is something that hot rodders deal with often, we thought it would be great to show and discuss the features of the X-Ray 1942 Ford. But before we do that, let’s take a quick look at the history of the Ford flathead V-8 between 1932 and 1942.

The flathead Ford V-8 was king of hot rodding in the early days of the sport. When introduced in 1932, it was a revolutionary engine. The flathead gave the average American driver a $460 car with 65 hp that could keep up with Buicks, Packards and other big multi-cylinder cars. Never had eight cylinders and so much power been offered for so little. In addition, the engine was well suited to performance modifications. It wasn’t long before a plethora of aftermarket speed equipment was offered to make the hot little Ford go even faster.

In 1933, the V-8 model got a longer, 112-inch wheelbase. But a stubborn Henry Ford refused to match Chevrolet’s move to independent front suspension in 1934. He said, “We use transverse springs for the same reason that we use round wheels – because we have found nothing better for the purpose.”

The V-8 Ford was a popular automobile. In 1935, it even managed to outsell Chevrolet, which was quite a feat back then. The performance potential of the Ford V-8 appealed to the go-faster crowd, whether its member be interested in a fast getaway (as with the bank-robbing Clyde Barrow, who wrote Henry Ford a testimonial letter) or a legal one (Ford V-8s virtually ruled stock car racing for several years, and Ford racing specials were a mainstay of the Automobile Racing Club of America in the mid-to-late 1930s).

In 1937, Ford introduced its smaller 60hp V-8 in a cheaper line of cars. Both it and the traditional V-8 (now at 85 hp) were fast cars, although they both had mechanical brakes that made high-speed driving a bit dangerous. The smaller V-8 was not a success at the time, but the little engines are still popular in certain vintage racing applications today.

The Ford V-8 finally got four-wheel hydraulic brakes in 1939, the same year that the Mercury V-8 was introduced. This was a big reason that the 1939 and 1940 Fords became tremendously popular with early hot rodders who wanted “juice brakes” in their cars.

The 1941 Fords had fresh styling and a revamped chassis with a two-inch-longer wheelbase. A wider body substantially increased interior dimensions. Base cars were dubbed Specials. Deluxe Fords had a glove box lock, dual windshield wipers, two interior sun visors and black-painted wheels. Only the center grille portion was chromed on Deluxe models. Super Deluxe Fords had bright trim on the running board edges and chrome grille sections. A Super Deluxe script was placed on the left front fender. They also had bright rear taillight surrounds, a trunk light, a glove box-mounted clock, bright wheel trim rings, twin interior sun visors, dual wipers, a unique license plate guard and plastic Kelobra-grain dashboard trim. The Super Deluxe wheels had Vermillion or Silver Gray striping.

The 1942 Fords that rode on Wayne Lensing’s X-Ray chassis were redesigned with fully concealed running boards, new front fenders and a new hood. The headlights were designed flush with the fronts of the fenders, and horizontal parking lights were located in the sheet metal above the grille. A new grille design featured a narrow center section in conjunction with side grilles considerably larger and more squared off than previous ones.

Common to all 1942 Fords was a revised frame design that was lower by one inch than the 1941 version. All 1942 Fords also had lower and wider leaf springs, a two-inch wider tread and dual lateral stabilizer bars. The transition to a wartime economy brought many material substitutes in the 1942 models. Among the more obvious were the use of plastic interior components and the replacement of nickel by molybdenum in valves, gears and shafts.

The new Ford looked larger and more massive. Riding comfort was improved slightly due to the use of longer springs. Larger brake pistons split the braking power 60-40 front and rear, instead of the previous 55-45. The redesigned frame was more rigid. New rubber rear engine mounts were adopted.

Deluxe models were equipped with the bumpers used on the 1941 Super Deluxe models. The grille frame was painted in body color. Unique to the Deluxe Ford was its center grille panel with “Deluxe” spelled out vertically, in bright letters, against a blue background. The wheel covers were painted to match body color. The Deluxe instrument panel was finished in Crackle Mahogany grain.

Ford’s Super Deluxe grille had its bright work accentuated by blue-painted grooves. The front and rear bumpers had ridges along their upper surface. A Super Deluxe script was now positioned just below the left headlight. The taillights on all 1942 models were horizontal, but the Super Deluxe lights had bright trim plates. Unique to Super Deluxe Fords was bright trim on the windshield, rear window and side windows. The wheel covers were painted to match body color and carried three stripes. Wheel trim rings were standard. The interior included an electric clock, a left-hand front door armrest, a steering wheel with a full-circle horn ring and crank-operated front vent windows. The instrument panel was done in Sequoia grain. Sedans and Sedan Coupes had assist cords.

Ford serial numbers were located on the left frame member directly behind the front engine mount. V-8 numbers started at 18-6769036 and ended at 18-6925878. A “C” prefix indicates a Canadian cart. Engine numbers for 1942 Ford V-8s were 18-6769036 to 18-6925898.

Only one flathead V-8 was offered in 1942. It was a 90-degree V-8 with a cast iron block and three main bearings. Its bore and stroke measurements were 3-1/16 x 3-3/4 inches for 221ci. With a 6.2:1 compression ratio it developed 95 hp at 3800 rpm and 156 lb-ft of torque at 2200 rpm. The engine had mechanical valve lifters and a Ford 21A-9510A two-barrel downdraft carburetor.

Perched on the 114-inch wheelbase introduced in 1941, the 1942 models measured 194.4 inches bumper-to-bumper. They were 68.15 inches high. They had a 58-inch front tread and 60-inch rear tread and rode on 6.00 x 16 tires.

Behind the V-8 was a three-speed sliding gear transmission with single reverse gear. Floor shift controls were featured. A single dry plate, molded asbestos lining clutch was used. The drive shaft connected to a three-quarter floating rear axle with a 3.78:1 overall ratio. Hydraulic brakes were mounted on all four wheels.

Popular accessories for 1942 Ford included fender skirts and center bumper guards. A radio was available for $39. A hot air heater cost $23, but a cheaper hot water heater was available for just $20. Whitewall tires were $15. Bumper guards retailed for just $2.75 a pair. An oil filter could be added to the engine for $6.14. Other dress-up goodies included a side view mirror, a passenger side mirror, a sport light, a locking gas cap, fog lights, seat covers, a visor-vanity mirror and wheel trim rings. Functional options included a defroster and a radio foot control feature.

The X-Ray chassis was built to promote new Ford features at auto shows. The “Big Foot” Ford monster truck sits behind it in the Lensing Auto Museum.


A flip sign teases museum visitors to guess the year of the X-ray Ford. Museum owner Wayne Lensing says that most hot rodders can hit the nail on the head or at least get pretty close.


This flip card suggests that the car was rolled off the assembly line incomplete to help the home front effort during World War II.


The 95hp V-8 first appeared in 1939, and rodders will kill for such a mill today. This one is fitted with the optional canister-type oil filter at the rear of the LH head.


If you want a true “old school” tire and wheel setup, this unaltered 1942 Ford X-Ray car serves as a perfect model of the way they were.


Many rodders replace the Ford gearbox, often with a LaSalle unit. Most modern rodders wind up ditching that (red) under-the-floor brake master cylinder.


Although hot rodders change many things from stock, it can be nice to have a “factory” reference for bending fluid lines and setting up pedal linkages.


The open 1942 drive shaft connected to a three-quarter floating rear axle with a 3.78:1 overall ratio. Transverse rear leaf springs were retained until 1949.


All Fords after 1932 had prelubricated shackle studs at each end of the rear leaf spring. Radius rods supported the rear axle with such a setup


Original Fords used a single exhaust system, but rodders prefer dual exhausts with a throaty “Smittie” muffler on each side of the chassis.


This is usually rusty junk when rodders access it, but for those relying on the factory brake and clutch linkages, this X-Ray Ford is a great reference point.


Rodders seeking the popular “Old School” look have their steering wheels restored like this, but the wheel on the show chassis is an untouched original.


The X-Ray Ford can’t be used to reference colors. The chassis and engine hues are not factory correct and the engine has added bright trim pieces.


The Ford factory stuck to primitive suspensions. You’re not going to see a lot of rodders retaining these NOS lever-type front shocks.


Both Fords and Mercurys adopted this Torsion Type Stabilizer when the 85hp cars arrived in 1940. Many rodders switch to sub-frame setups today.


Any hot rodders who keep the factory suspension could use the X-Ray Ford to determine the correct placement of each part.


The gas tank is mounted at the rear of the chassis. Note the rubber body mounting “donuts” on the rear of the frame and at the top of the kick-up.


Sturdy squared-off U-bolts (which are 70 years old but still look like new) were used to attach the transverse rear spring to the chassis cross member.


This is usually rusty junk when rodders access it, but for those relying on the factory brake and clutch linkages, this X-Ray Ford is a great reference point.


Also displayed at the Lensing Auto Museum is this 239ci 100hp 1948 Mercury flathead that is stock on its blue side. (Note changed oil filter location.).


The other side of the Mercury V-8 is painted red and represents a typical modified 320-cid flathead with dual carbs, Offenhauser heads and 238-250hp.

Source: Gunnell, John. “The Rarest Pre-War Ford – 1942 “X-Ray” Chassis.”AutoTraderClassics.com. N.p., n.d. Web. 12 Feb. 2015.

title.rendered: Moronic Driver Saved by Trucker

content.rendered: At a busy intersection a car tries to cut across traffic and nearly pays the price for it. Luckily, the trucker that was about to plow through the individual’s car somehow reacts quickly enough to swerve every inch of their truck out of the way before tumbling over on their side. The angle of the traffic camera suggests the car driver just took off but I’d like to think that after staring down death itself only to be saved at the last second by someone’s else proper driving ability, they hopefully pulled over and rushed to check on the trucker.

title.rendered: Super Wealthy Southern California Car Club

content.rendered: There are tons of Chinese families who have the money and means to send their kids the United States for education. Many of those families are so absurdly wealthy that their kids must want for nothing and sleep on piles of money. A number of those kids have cash to burn so they’ve focused their sights on collecting and owning a great many sports and luxury cars. Vocativ tracked down one such group that gets together to compare their purchases. Argue all you want if you think there’s a gross disconnect with reality going on for many of these kids but if you were just walking around southern California one night and stumbled upon this scene your jaw would definitely drop!

title.rendered: Film Stunt Gone Awry

content.rendered: This footage came from the filming of an unknown chase scene for an unknown movie. What it provides us with is a scary example of why stunts need to be coordinated past the point of unhealthy memorization. It appears that the stunt car hit its jump entirely too fast which soon posed a great danger for the crew and onlookers. While it’s reported that no one was hurt during the accident, it’s still important to remember that the professionals should never shirk any detail for any reason for any stunt!

Its also got neon lights running around the floor boards and along the interior of the trunk that’s lined with vinyl upholstery!

title.rendered: Russians Try Getting out of a Speeding Ticket by Speaking English

content.rendered:
A pair of Russians are traveling in Ukraine when the police pull them over for speeding. They try to escape getting a ticket by speaking English, hoping the officer will become too confused or frustrated and let them go. It works on the first officer, but then the second officer comes along…

Passenger: Cops! Look…
Driver: Ohhh, come on. Are you kidding me?
Passenger: What do they want from us?
Driver: Okay… I’ve exceeded the speed limit, so what?
Passenger: Crap! Why? We are in a foreign country…
Driver: Oh come on… Let’s trick him in English, you know they are dumb.
Passenger: Wow, right! Talk to him in English, yeah?
Driver: Okay, just don’t giggle!
Passenger: I won’t! And you try not to!
Officer 1: Road Police Sergeant Kolomiets. Please show your IDs. / IDs! IDs! IDs! Do you understand me? IDs! / STOP! One moment!
Officer 2: Good day! Road Police Senior Inspector Kucher. / Okay, let’s issue you some tickets.

title.rendered: Ricer Tries Outrunning Police on the Wrong Side of the Highway and in Reverse

content.rendered:
In America, they’re known as ricers. In the UK, they’re known as boy racers, and we have a prime example of one right here.

If you can withstand the obnoxious laughter of the guy recording the video, you’ll get to witness some scary moments when a reckless ricer tries escaping the police first by cutting across the median guardrail and driving down the opposite side of the highway. When the police beat him to the end of the railing, he makes the even more terrifying decision to drive in reverse, still on the wrong side of the highway, and at 60 mph. He circles the guardrail and a roundabout further up the street a few times in an attempt to give the police the slip, which doesn’t seem like the best plan.

title.rendered: 2015 GMC Yukon Denali XL vs. Dodge Challenger Hellcat

content.rendered:
This week John Hennessey got behind the wheel of his tuned 2015 GMC Yukon Denali XL, an SUV behemoth, with the goal of proving the speed performance of his products. To do that, he participated in a quarter-mile launch drag race against the above-average sports car known as the Dodge Challenger Hellcat.

The Yukon sported a supercharged 6.2-liter V8 engine, which means a beefy 665 horsepower and 658 lb-ft of torque put to the crank. The Hellcat got off to a rough start, but the Yukon still did outstanding for a seven-seat SUV.

title.rendered: Tesla Slaughters a Hellcat in Drag Race

content.rendered:
Saturday, January 17, 2014 at Palm Beach International Raceway, a Tesla Model S P85D and a 2015 Dodge Challenger Hellcat competed in the traditional quarter-mile drag race.

StreetCarDrags provided video coverage of the historic even on their YouTube channel and the results might shock you. the Tesla P85D set a new world record for the fastest-accelerating electric car, with a quarter-mile time of 11.6 seconds and a speed through the finish of 114.6 mph.

Granted, the two cars aren’t perfectly comparable since the Tesla is a five-seat luxury sedan with four doors and a hatchback, while the Challenger is a traditional muscle-car coupe with only two doors and a trunk. These striking differences point towards only one reason why the electric luxury car brutally dominated the old-style gasoline muscle car so decisively: All four wheels are powered. Not only that, but its drive-control software adjusts the power delivered to each wheel to ensure that front and rear both have equal traction, which maximizes the total torque delivered to each wheel without any loss of traction. The Hellcat, as we see in the video, is all about rear-wheel burnout.

title.rendered: Two Men Filmed a Woman’s Erratic Driving and Got Caught in the Cross Hairs

content.rendered:
Two Pennsylvania men were driving through Fayette county when they noticed the woman in the car ahead of them was swerving all over the road. At first, they assumed she was falling asleep.

The two men started recording the video, saying “I don’t know if she’s drunk or what’s going on. They need to get their mind right. I hope nothing happens to them.”

The woman signaled to turn as a pick-up truck sped towards her sideways vehicle. Instead of getting perfectly t-boned, the truck hit the rear of her car, which caused a head on collision with the men filming. The passenger told the driver to “slow down” just before the event happened, thinking that something bad was going to happen.

In the end, everyone came away alive, but this was a truly frightening series of events.

(H/T Rare)

title.rendered: The Most Expensive Car Wash in the World

content.rendered:
He claims that what he does is a “higher form of cleaning” that “restores the surface, mainly paintwork, to a level that is better than brand new.”

He starts with a normal wash and dry, but then he decontaminates the car to cleanse the surface of cleaning chemicals. Next, he measures and analyzes the paint under a microscope to check for defects that need repairing. When repairing the scratches, he measures the thickness of the clear coat with and ultrasonic depth gauge so he knows how deep to go, reducing the risk of needing a completely new paint job. After repairing scratches, he moves on to waxing, which costs approximately $12,200 (8,000 British Pounds) per container of wax.

A standard exterior treatment can take up to 250 hours spread out over 4-6 weeks and costs at least $1,060 (700 British Pounds).

title.rendered: Giant Mud Truck Rolls and Makes a Big Splash

content.rendered:
rekjavicxxx a.k.a. Triple X Motorsports & Outdoors is a YouTube channel self-described as a “community of some of the greatest on and off-road enthusiasts in the South!”

This particular video features Jesse Johnson in his GMC 4×4 at Sabine River Rats near Marshall, Texas on February 5, 2011. While out enjoying a good ole boy mud run, his truck reared up like a bucking bronco and then fell on its side like a dying dinosaur. The video description assured that no one was hurt. “After truck was uprighted, [the]motor was verified to be dry. Oil was added and he rode the rest of the day with no problems!”

content.rendered: Check out this incredible video of how much fun you can have when you get to take a modified 2015 Chevrolet Corvette C7 and open it up on a completely barren and empty Texas highway! This is even the first C7 to break 200 miles per hour!

title.rendered: Check Out This 1000 HP Three-Wheeler

content.rendered: Tim “Frogman” Cotterill worked on the Rocket II for three years to turn it into the monster you see before you. It boasts a 426 Hemi V8 engine that can propel this beast to 100 mph in 4.5 seconds. Its top speed has yet to be determined, but it’s sure to be anything but leisurely.

title.rendered: Ever Heard of the Tweel?

content.rendered:
The Tweel can never go flat and never be punctured.  Michelin dedicated a new South Carolina factory to making the Tweel; a “tire/wheel” that uses flexible spindles where a conventional tire holds air. After talking about it for a decade Michelin is finally going to start making it in quantities.

We’ve seen Tweels tested on just about everything from wheelchairs to lunar rovers, and they’ve even already been sold to consumers for small skid-steer loader construction vehicles. Michelin’s Vice President of Tweel Technologies Ralph Dimenna told Greenville News they’ve sold “thousands” for that application, and that the company has run up to the limit they could produce with “prototype-making equipment.”

Apparently the Tweel is a dream the Michelin’s keen to keep chasing, because as of today the company’s allocated $50 million, a 135,000 square-foot facility, and 100 staff members dedicated to consistently producing Tweels.

Dimenna went on to say the Tweel is focused on “lower-speed, off-road applications where downtime from flat tires is a concern,” though former Michelin research director Ralph Hulseman thinks the Tweel will see duty on passenger cars at some point in the future.

For now, the Tweel will be the OEM “tire” on the John Deere ZTrak 900 lawn mower.

title.rendered: Watch as a Bicycle Leaves a Ferrari in the Dust!!

content.rendered: François Gissy is pretty much our hero. He had the guts to strap a rocket onto a bicycle and then ride the thing at top speeds of 207 mph! He did a quarter mile in less than 7 seconds! We still haven’t picked our jaws up off the floor yet. And then, just to put the cherry on top, he raced against a Ferrari 430 and totally dominated it on the track. Remind us to not underestimate the French anymore.
